Dutch Olympic team shields beach volleyball player, convicted child rapist Steven van de Velde from media https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sport/dutch-olympic-team-shields-beach-volleyball-player-convicted-child-rapist-steven-van-de-velde-from-media/ZRCMTMXUWVGTNHW2GXE2AHU2G4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sport/dutch-olympic-team-shields-beach-volleyball-player-convicted-child-rapist-steven-van-de-velde-from-media/ZRCMTMXUWVGTNHW2GXE2AHU2G4/ Oliver BrownSteven van de Velde was ushered away from the press after being roundly booed on court. Patching over: King Cobras defect to Comancheros as gang expands into rival’s turf in Auckland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ Jared Savage, George BlockComanchero takeover could inflame tensions in volatile gang sceneSat, 27 Jul 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The new central Auckland chapter of the notorious international outlaw gang the Comanchero Motorcycle Club (CMC) announced their arrival with this post on a private social media page, shared widely in the underworld. The ACCA acronym features in many Comanchero tattoos, clothing items and social media posts - the pledge stands for "Always Comancheros, Comancheros Always". The 1% denotes outlaw motorcycle clubs, who embrace the term "one percenters" alluding to a comment by a former president of the American Motorcyclist Association (AMA) who said 99 percent of riders were law-biding while the remainder were outlaws.
